subject: Law
title: Judicial Review: Marbury v. Madison
description: A micro-lesson that makes Judicial Review: Marbury v. Madison usable.

hook.text: In 1803, the Supreme Court gave itself one of the most powerful tools in legal historyâ€”and nobody stopped them.

buildup.text: William Marbury wanted his judicial commission. Secretary Madison refused to deliver it. Marbury sued.

discovery.text: Chief Justice Marshall ruled Marbury had a right to the commission but the Court lacked jurisdiction to order it.

twist.text: The real power move: Marshall declared part of a federal law unconstitutionalâ€”establishing judicial review.

climax.text: From that day on, courts could strike down any law that violated the Constitution.

punchline.text: The Court's greatest power wasn't in the Constitution. It was claimed.

quiz.question: What power did Marbury v. Madison establish?
